name: honorifically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is intended to show honour and respect, often without expecting much to be done in return: He was honorifically made a trustee of the bank. In many languages, the third person pronoun is honorifically used when referring to a superior, either in age or any other social attribute.
More examplesFewer examplesSome of them speak with regional accents and idioms, even when speaking honorifically.These employees can be paid only for the work that they actually do, and not honorifically.
